tool.name: DelineateUsingStartingPoint

param.name: StreamSelectionType
param.expression: Upstream with Tributaries | Upstream Main Path Only | Downstream with Divergences | Downstream Main Path Only
param.dialogReference: Navigation methodology for network discovery of events. Delineation for the most part is always going to utilize Upstream with Tributaries. However, the other alternatives are provided for specialty use cases.

param.name: StartingPoint
param.dialogReference: Coordinate location to be indexed to the appropriate NHDPlus flowline from which to begin navigation.

param.name: MaxDistanceKm
param.dialogReference: Maximum distance limiter for navigation in kilometers. Provide the keyword "COMPLETE" to obtain the entire (precalculated) watershed.

param.name: MaxFlowtimeDay
param.dialogReference: Maximum flowtime limiter for navigation in days.

param.name: ShowSelectedStreams
param.dialogReference: Flag to return the flowlines utilized to determine the aggregation. When requesting complete watersheds, be aware whilst the watershed is precalculated, the flowline network is not and must be generated by the service call. For large watersheds this may not return results.

param.name: ShowSelectedCatchments
param.dialogReference: Flag to return the individual catchments utilized to determine the aggregation. When requesting complete watersheds, be aware whilst the watershed is precalculated, the catchment aggreagtion not and must be generated by the service call. For large watersheds this may not return results.

param.name: AdvancedConfiguration
param.dialogReference: Keywords for advanced usage of the service. Currently non-functional.

tool.summary: The EPA Office of Water Watershed Delineation Service provides an areal representation of the navigation process by linking navigated flowlines to associated catchment geographies. For more information see <a href='https://watersgeo.epa.gov/openapi/waters/#/Delineation/x131' target='_blank'>EPA service documentation</a>.
